senses.definition: to produce something, for example by putting the different parts of it together

examples.text: I’m going to show you how to make a box for your tools.
examples.translation: 我来教你怎么做一个箱子存放工具。

examples.text: A family of mice had made their nest in the roof.
examples.translation: 一窝老鼠在屋顶上安了家。

examples.text: She made her own wedding dress.
examples.translation: 她的婚纱是自己做的。

senses.definition: used with some nouns to say that someone does something
senses.definition_cn: 进行，作出〔与某些名词连用﹐表示某人做某事〕

examples.text: Anyone can make a mistake.
examples.translation: 任何人都可能犯错。

examples.text: I can’t make a decision just yet.
examples.translation: 我还没法作出决定。

examples.text: I need to make a quick phone call.
examples.translation: 我需要很快地打个电话。

senses.definition: to cook or prepare food or drink

examples.text: When was the last time you made a cake?
examples.translation: 你上次做蛋糕是什么时候？

examples.text: John was making breakfast in the kitchen.
examples.translation: 约翰在厨房做早餐。

examples.text: Who’s going to make the tea?
examples.translation: 谁去泡茶？

senses.definition: to cause something to happen, or cause a particular state or condition

examples.text: Its beautiful beaches make this a highly popular area with tourists.
examples.translation: 美丽的海滩使这里成为游客云集的地方。

examples.text: It was this movie which made him a star.
examples.translation: 就是这部电影使他成为明星的。

examples.text: His attitude made him very unpopular with colleagues.
examples.translation: 他的态度使他很不受同事欢迎。

senses.definition: to force someone to do something

examples.text: My parents always make me do my homework before I go out.
examples.translation: 我父母总是要我做完作业才能出去。

examples.text: I was made to wait four hours before I was examined by a doctor.
examples.translation: 我被迫等了四个小时才有一个医生给我做检查。

examples.text: My parents always make me do my homework before I go out.
examples.translation: 我父母总是要我做完作业才能出去。

senses.definition: to cause a mark, hole etc to appear

examples.text: Make a hole in the paper.
examples.translation: 在纸上挖一个洞。

examples.text: The cup has made a mark on the table.
examples.translation: 茶杯在桌上留了个印痕。

senses.definition: to succeed in getting somewhere in time for something or when this is difficult
senses.definition_cn: 〔尤指在困难情况下〕准时到达﹐赶上

examples.text: If we run, we should make it.
examples.translation: 如果我们跑的话﹐应该来得及。

examples.text: With blood pouring from his leg, he made it to a nearby house.
examples.translation: 虽然腿上鲜血直流﹐他还是坚持走到了附近的一所房子。

examples.text: He came to the US and not only made it but made it big (=was extremely successful).
examples.translation: 他来到美国﹐不仅成功了﹐而且是大获成功。

senses.definition: to be able to go to something that has been arranged for a particular date or time
senses.definition_cn: 能够出席[参加]会议/聚会/周二的活动等

examples.text: I’m sorry, I can’t make Friday after all.
examples.translation: 对不起﹐我礼拜五还是不行。

examples.text: Will you be able to make the next meeting?
examples.translation: 下一个会议你能参加吗？

senses.definition: to succeed in achieving a particular position, rate etc
senses.definition_cn: 成功获得[达到]〔某一位置﹑速度等〕

examples.text: He was never good enough to make the team.
examples.translation: 他一直都不够好﹐进不了球队。

examples.text: I don’t think we’ll make the deadline.
examples.translation: 我认为我们无法按时完成。

examples.text: The plan could cost you more than you would make.
examples.translation: 这个计划可能会让你入不敷出。

examples.text: They made a profit of £140 million.
examples.translation: 他们获得了1.4亿英镑的利润。

examples.text: His one aim in life was to make money.
examples.translation: 他人生的一个目标就是挣钱。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to steal something and take it away with you

examples.text: Thieves made away with the contents of the safe.
examples.translation: 小偷把保险柜里的东西都偷走了。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to go in the direction of a particular place

examples.text: I think it’s time we made for home.
examples.translation: 我想我们该回家了。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to change something so that it has a different form or purpose

examples.text: We can make your room into a study.
examples.translation: 我们可以把你的房间改成书房。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to have a particular opinion about or understanding of something or someone

examples.text: I didn’t know what to make of her.
examples.translation: 我不知道该如何看待她。

examples.text: What do you make of the idea?
examples.translation: 你对这个主意有什么看法？

phrasal_verbs.definition: to leave quickly, especially in order to escape
phrasal_verbs.definition_cn: 〔尤指为了逃跑〕匆忙离开，溜掉

examples.text: The men made off as the police arrived.
examples.translation: 警察一到这些人就赶快开溜。

examples.text: The getaway car made off towards Horrocks Avenue.
examples.translation: 逃逸汽车往霍罗克斯大街方向开去。

examples.text: The getaway car made off towards Horrocks Avenue.
examples.translation: 逃逸汽车往霍罗克斯大街方向开去。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to steal something and take it away with you

examples.text: Thieves broke into the school and made off with computer equipment worth £40,000.
examples.translation: 窃贼闯入学校﹐盗走了价值四万英镑的计算机设备。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to be just able to see or hear something

examples.text: He could just make out a dark shape moving towards him.
examples.translation: 他隐约看到有个黑影朝他走来。

examples.text: I couldn’t make out what he was saying.
examples.translation: 我听不清他在说些什么。

examples.text: I couldn’t make out what he was saying.
examples.translation: 我听不清他在说些什么。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to change a person or thing into something else

examples.text: The Olympics can make sporting heroes out of previously little-known athletes.
examples.translation: 奥运会能把原本名不见经传的运动员变成体育英雄。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to officially and legally give money or property to someone else
phrasal_verbs.definition_cn: 〔正式合法地〕转让〔钱财或不动产〕

examples.text: He made over the whole estate to his son.
examples.translation: 他把全部财产转让给了自己的儿子。

examples.text: He made over the whole estate to his son.
examples.translation: 他把全部财产转让给了自己的儿子。

examples.text: She made towards the door.
examples.translation: 她向门口走去。

simple_forms.person: I, you, he, she, it, we, they
I, you, he, she, it, we, they
I, you, he, she, it, we, they
I, you, he, she, it, we, they

continuous_forms.person: I, you, he, she, it, we, they
I, you, he, she, it, we, they
I, you, he, she, it, we, they

extra_examples.text: "How much do I owe you for the meal?'' "I make it $10.50.''
a bag made of leather
a car made in Japan
Archie doesn't even make an effort to help out around the house.
At school the other kids always made jokes about my name.
British Telecom made over $3 billion last year.
Carol's making carrot cake for dessert.
Children with the disease rarely make it past their tenth birthday.
Cooper's going to make a good doctor one day.
Diane makes all her own clothes.
Did you make that dress yourself?
Don't they make a cute couple?
Ella makes a lot of money.
Engineers have been working throughout the night to make the bridge safe.
For me, the trip to Caracas made the holiday.
He'll make a good father.
He made two small holes in the wood.
He could make things very difficult for us.
He ran 30 yards to make his second touchdown of the quarter.
He was starting to wonder if he would ever make it in the Major Leagues.

entries.definition: used about things you make yourself, or things that are made in a factory制作﹔制造
examples: Diane makes all her own clothes.黛安娜的衣服都是自己做的。
My camera was made in China.我的相机是中国制造的。

entries.definition: to make something in large quantities to be sold, or to make something as the result of a natural process制造﹐生产﹔产生
examples: The factory produces high-quality steel.该工厂生产优质钢材。
Japan produces some of the most advanced mobile phones.
The pancreas is a gland in your body which produces hormones.胰腺是人体内分泌激素的一个腺体。

entries.definition: to make something new and original创造
examples: Tarantino created a whole new style of films.塔伦蒂诺创造了一种全新的电影风格。
Many companies invest a lot of money in creating new products.许多公司投入大笔资金创制新产品。
Potter was famous for creating characters such as ‘Peter Rabbit’.

entries.definition: to make machines, cars, equipment etc in factories〔在工厂〕生产﹐制造〔机器﹑汽车﹑设备等〕
examples: The company manufactures aircraft parts.该公司生产飞机零部件。

entries.definition: to make very large quantities of something in a factory〔在工厂〕大批量生产
examples: They developed a way to mass-produce the drug.他们研发出一种新方法﹐可以大批量生产这种药物。

entries.definition: to design and make something new over a period of time研制〔新产品〕
examples: In 1962, Enders developed an effective vaccine against measles.1962年﹐恩德斯研制出一种可有效预防麻疹的疫苗。
The company is developing new anti-virus software.该公司正在开发一款新的杀毒软件。

entries.definition: to make something as the result of a natural process or chemical reaction〔经过自然过程或化学反应而〕形成,产生
examples: Hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water.氢和氧结合生成水。
The research will help us understand how planets are formed.这项研究可帮助我们了解行星是怎样形成的。

entries.definition: to make something such as heat, electricity, or power产生〔热﹑电﹑动力等〕
examples: Wind can be used to generate electricity.风力可用来发电。

entries.definition: to produce something which did not exist before
examples: Diane makes all her own clothes.黛安娜的衣服都是自己做的。
The furniture was made by a Swedish firm.
They've just finished making a movie about life during the Civil War.

entries.definition: to make large quantities of food, equipment, or other goods by means of industrial processes
examples: The dairy produced over 1500 tonnes of butter per year.
They produce cheap goods for export to the United States.
a factory that produces high-quality steel

Hank had made no attempt to defend himself.
It was right outside the wire where they had made their attempt to breach the perimeter.

It's at this point that you have to start making choices, and you have several options.

Instead of lying in bed they are up and about and have freedom to make choices about their routine and daily life.

Students occasionally make silly, ridiculous comments that are not likely to be true.
We made the following comments on such expectations.
Beier denied making such comments and said Clark was a good manager.
Our reader was invited to make his annual contribution to his Equitable Life pension plan.
To be sure, some small-business lobbying groups do not make political contributions.

He thought she would make a splendid contribution.

senses.definition: the name of a particular product or of the company that makes it

examples.text: What make is your car?
examples.translation: 你的车是什么牌子的？

examples.text: It’s one of the most popular makes of satellite phone on the market.
examples.translation: 这是市场上最流行的卫星电话品牌之一。

examples.text: It’s one of the most popular makes of satellite phone on the market.
examples.translation: 这是市场上最流行的卫星电话品牌之一。

senses.definition: to be trying to get money or power – used to show disapproval

examples.text: He was just a salesman on the make.
examples.translation: 他就是个只想赚钱的推销员。

extra_examples.text: "What make of car was she driving?" "A Mercedes."
Mention the missile but not the make.
Not poverty beaten down, poverty rather on the make, without being clever enough to make it.
To my knowledge there are currently four different makes of locator available.

entries.definition: the name of a type of product made by a company, especially one that you use every day such as food or cleaning products
examples: a survey to find out which brand of toothpaste people prefer
advertising for a well-known brand of cigarettes

entries.definition: a type of product made by a particular company – used especially about things such as machines, equipment, or cars
examples: ‘What make of car do you drive?’ ‘A Ford.’

entries.definition: one particular type or design of a vehicle, machine etc
examples: The new models are much faster.

entries.definition: to produce something which did not exist before
examples: Diane makes all her own clothes.黛安娜的衣服都是自己做的。
The furniture was made by a Swedish firm.
They've just finished making a movie about life during the Civil War.

entries.definition: to make large quantities of food, equipment, or other goods by means of industrial processes
examples: The dairy produced over 1500 tonnes of butter per year.
They produce cheap goods for export to the United States.
a factory that produces high-quality steel

entries.definition: to make machines, equipment, cars etc in factories
examples: He works for a small company manufacturing aluminium products.
The car was designed, developed, and manufactured in collaboration with Honda.

entries.definition: to make goods in very large quantities using special industrial processes
examples: Henry Ford made his fortune mass-producing the Model T.
The bike is the first mass-produced bicycle to have full front and rear suspension.

entries.definition: to make large quantities of things, especially without caring about quality
examples: They turn out cheap souvenirs for tourists.
Churning out pamphlets and booklets is ineffective if consumers cannot understand the messages.
As long as people keep buying these products, the company will keep turning them out.

entries.definition: to invent something new and original in art, music, fashion etc
examples: Picasso created a completely new style of painting.
She wanted to create a garden to complement her beautiful home.
This dish was created by master chef Marco Pierre White.

entries.definition: to make something using your hands or simple tools
examples: Two million years ago our ancestors began to fashion stone tools.
The man had fashioned a turban from a strip of torn cloth.

examples.text: To my knowledge there are currently four different makes of locator available.
A convertible drove by, but it was white and a different make.
